commit bcf4ecc739215067cb264eb9b527670175934ee9
Author: No Author <dev-null@apache.org>
Date:   Mon Feb 11 00:27:41 2002 +0000

    New repository initialized by cvs2svn.
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134821 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 93d0a4435575eca9bafcb2f4b203e19344022c40
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Mon Feb 11 00:27:41 2002 +0000

    First alpha-cut of a little research project called Jelly. Its a simple XML tag based scripting language. It borrows ideas from JSP taglibs, Velocity and XDoclet. For those that like Velocity-style syntax we should be able to layer a non-XML parser on top of the standard XML representation. Its still work in progress but any comments would be welcome
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134822 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit e599fdcbb60836781c3a2256196d4965cb4c445e
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Mon Feb 11 18:14:17 2002 +0000

    Added Geir as a committer, added an API to register namespaceURIs with TagLibrary instances and added more to the TODO.txt
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134823 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 889bbfd4eaed263324b63229aac289b021ca9f80
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Tue Feb 12 21:34:35 2002 +0000

    Added more examples and things to do. Also added parent relationship to Tag interface and make the body script a property of Tags so that they can modify and change their body at will (e.g. be a pre-processor or macro). Also added early version of core tags with a stub implementation of ExpressionFactory which I'll try get working with beanshell. A velocity & rhino implementation would be nice too...
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134824 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 8b3348af653765f261b31fe81e349b935e0938f4
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Feb 13 16:00:39 2002 +0000

    Added support for BeanShell expressions in the core tags along with some unit tests. Unfortunately things are a bit of a kludge to support BeanShell - some changes are required to make it more optimal like (i) supporting a compile() of beanshell expressions and (ii) having to explicitly push in all variables in the context via Interpreter.set() rather than it being able to pull them from somewhere. Hopefully a neater EL could be Velocity.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134825 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 4fe257ac3d2586890bca7b1151e801b51f8d2cd0
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Feb 13 17:03:09 2002 +0000

    Modified the core tags so that the common tags expect an expression for their attributes. Tags which do not explicitly expect an expression for their attribute values can take {} around the expressions which will then be evaluated as an expression. This is kinda similar to 'Attribute Value Templates' in XSLT. It certainly makes common core tags look much simpler. Also added a sample script to output the current system properties as a HTML table to show the general idea
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134826 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 105415fd32404cd24919cba4b7d431fe2a3006ae
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Fri Feb 15 18:25:06 2002 +0000

    Added core conditional tags from JSTL with a little example
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134827 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

Date:   Thu Mar 7 03:57:13 2002 +0000

Right now there's a minor hack in there to get it to work. Also for some wierd reason JavaScript (Rhino) doesn't see declared beans.

commit 91a2dc9ff2a87d8f6b854c948875f2a9a3cca335
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Sun Mar 10 00:56:33 2002 +0000

    Updated the overview a little more showing an example action in source code and in use in a Jelly script.

commit e0060e392c83a285ed9710f27172b61585cb237d
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Apr 24 11:59:13 2002 +0000

    Refactored the Jelly engine to be XML native. Jelly now uses a class called XMLOutput which is-a SAX ContentHandler. This means that each custom tag is essentially a tap in the SAX pipestream. Indeed a custom tag can easily filter its body in a typical SAX pipeline like that used in Cocoon. Updated the documentation to reflect the new core dependencies
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134836 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 60680b5cbee3c95fdaa4e9fdfdb93a52d7097289
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Apr 24 13:03:03 2002 +0000

    Added support for Jexl and made it the default expression language when using Jelly
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134837 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit cf087874a3eac5805826020137868119eab04a23
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Fri Apr 26 11:28:55 2002 +0000

    Added support in the Context for getResource() to allow loading of resources via explicit URL or relative URI as well as a compile and run methods to invoke other jelly scripts from inside jelly. This needs testing but the code is just about there I think. Also fixed the invokeBody tag so that it works fine now - though it uses a private variable 'jelly.body' which is not ideal but works fine.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134847 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit e7049c57dd6d80098bd885354dca5407586ba709
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed May 15 16:21:06 2002 +0000

    Tidied up the code a bit more, removing some old logging messages.
    
    Also made loading of tag libraries lazy so that the standard library does not force jar dependencies until tags get used. e.g. javax.sql.* is only needed if you use the new SQL tags.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134854 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 476271e5698e92d943cc621947fa59ccd5dd9d92
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Thu May 16 16:29:55 2002 +0000

    Updated the Tag invocation protocol to be very close to JSP1.3; though taking an XMLOutput parameter to denote XML operations, and using a JellyContext rather than a PageContext. Also added a <c:new var="foo" className="java.util.List"/> extension tag.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134855 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

    Started to add some Jelly-based unit testing. Though some assert and assertEquals tags should be useful.

    Could do with some JUnit tags of the form...
    
    <junit:assert test="${foo == 22}">some description</junit:assert>
    <junit:assertEquals value="${foo}" expected="${22}"some description</junit:assert>

    ant demo.hw
    
    for the hello world script or
    
    ant demo.ant
    
    for the Ant based demo.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134866 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 4157cd6bfbfe61d0b85f3dda233624523d3c9977
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Tue May 21 19:36:56 2002 +0000

    Imported the old build targets from the old pre-Maven build so that the SQL scripts can now be run properly. For example
    
    ant demo.sql
    
    will run various example SQL scripts on a database (using Ant properties to connect) and generate some XML documents in the target directory.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134867 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 833145fe23a86518739c2a051f0b36002cacf2f0
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed May 22 08:43:13 2002 +0000

    Changed build targets to use classic ${maven.home}/build-maven.xml rather than reference the plugins directory which doesn't seem to work on older Maven builds.

commit 605587f6f7e20ad2a5ded27782bc21d9e0b6202b
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Thu May 23 22:28:46 2002 +0000

    Updated the build so that it now reuses the classpath created by the Maven build to allow compiled code to be run as part of the projects build.xml easily, without having to replicate the JAR dependencies that are inside the project.xml definition.
    
    So its easy to add a new build target that runs a new Jelly script; the 'compile' task defines a new <jelly> task using the current build and Maven's classpath.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134874 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit b855d0ada387d0f88bcabe34c3e1937b3881c0bb

commit 3e1c4f9b3642a6c021d98de14c190b4bc33403a9
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Sat May 25 18:27:22 2002 +0000

    Added support for Jelly Stylesheet Language tags (JSL) which are an implementation of an XSLT style declarative transformation engine.
    
    The whole thing uses 3 tags, <jsl:stylesheet>, <jsl:template> and <jsl:applyTemplates> that work neatly with the XML taglib from JSTL.
    This allows XSLT like processing to be cleanly mixed with JSTL tags in a single Jelly script; also JSL is totally dynamic, so the stylesheet can be dynamically created and invoked.
    
    There are example targets demo.jsl and demo.jsl2 that demonstrate JSL in action
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134880 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit c3104c56199fab0988925d65a5bb0367a49cf236

commit 9700dfb7cfdaa38544fda64353bf412121e309d6
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Thu May 30 08:13:50 2002 +0000

    Added an Ant tag library which can invoke Ant tasks from inside a Jelly script.
    Invoking Tasks is working fine, though support for Ant DataTypes isn't quite working yet (like nested <classpath> elements). Should have that working soon.
    
    Also added a new DynaBeanTagSupport class for developers wishing to use a DynaBean to hold tag attribute values.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134889 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit db19bfb14c5a7f2774f5309094caff23e5d80165
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Thu May 30 11:03:20 2002 +0000

    Imported all the XML tags into the JSL tag library namespace, as per James Elson's suggestion, so that XSLT documents can be converted to Jelly pretty quicky by just changing the namespace URI.
    
    (We could do with providing mixedCaseTags -> mixed-case-tags aliases also - could be a standard TagLibrary feature).
    
    Also added an alias of <valueOf> which uses the Expr tag from the XML tag library
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134890 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 998bb500d8fd39e033a3a14de3662ee457d7bfda
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>

    Patched the XMLParser so that it correctly sets the parent relationship, using a stack of tags. This fixes the bug where certain tags would have the wrong parent.
    Thanks go to Hristo for spotting this one.

commit 20c553bd4ccc9ffc2a108bee1d09cfbde82d442e
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Thu May 30 14:58:30 2002 +0000

    Applied patch suggested by Hristo to use a Statement rather than a PreparedStatement when no parameters are being used which can perform quicker on some JDBC drivers

commit 844a4067f0dd804cd8595c6b671c5560ae203865
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Thu May 30 16:47:17 2002 +0000

    Added a getParent() relationship to JellyContext so that parent relationships can be traversed (such as across <j:include> scripts).
    Also now the variable "context" is available in the EL for the current context.
    You can refer to a parent context as context.parent or context.parent.parent etc.
    
    Finally I've added a helper method (along with a little test script) that provides a helper method to find a varaible in any context, starting with the current context traversing up the parent hierarchy. e.g.
    
    <j:set var="foo" value='${context.findVariable("something")}'/>
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134895 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 743a5c3d6bf6ade0efa30837e34fce36dbe0f752
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Sat Jun 1 10:21:14 2002 +0000

    Refactored code in SQL tags a little bit to share code across the query and update tags.
    
    We could now add smartQuery and smartUpdate tags that allow <param> tags to denote where a ? should be, to make it easier to line up params with '?'
    
    e.g.
    
    <sql:smartQuery>
    update foo set a = <sql:param value="${foo}"/> where b = <sql:param value="${bar}"/>
    </sql:smartQuery>
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134909 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 60c8d94af1cc391c3c169688dbdbd4fc707f3614
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Sun Jun 2 05:15:41 2002 +0000

    added new item in to do list; support for embedded ${foo} expressions inside attributes and elements text
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134910 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 0e34790da9636036e933a8389166e68c6a1cac70
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Sun Jun 2 17:29:02 2002 +0000

    Added a new <fileScanner> tag which creates a new FileScanner bean of the given variable name, using Ant <fileset> elements.
    
    This allows files to be scanned (iterated over) using the standard <j:forEach> tag via
    
    <fileScanner var="scanner">
      <fileset dir="foo" includes="**/*.xml"/>
    </fileScanner>
    <j:forEach var="file" items="${scanner.iterator()}">
            ...
    
    This mechanism is particularly useful for finding files to process, performing recursive builds and so forth.
    It allows a nice mix of Ant tasks/datatypes and Jelly tags.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134911 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 43f40f85b8d3da96c311c738273423836aa478c4

Date:   Sun Jun 2 18:00:38 2002 +0000

    Updated the build and project POM to the latest Maven CVS HEAD
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134912 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit ee2d433b53a76bb17b874d63b436bfa70fab04a8
Author: Bob McWhirter <werken@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Jun 5 07:00:58 2002 +0000

    The <core:include> tag now can tag 2 additional attributes:
    
            inhert="(true|false)" which describes that the included
            jellyscript inherits all variables from the one that
            actually uses the <include>.
    
            export="(true|false)" which describes that the included
            jellyscript exports all of its locally-set variables
            to the one that actually uses the <include>.
    
    Things seem to still work.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134918 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 8e6c3baf843495e13c156cb193d799cdabe90ee4
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Jun 5 07:12:58 2002 +0000

    Added the registration of some beanutils Converters for standard Ant type coercions, like File and Reference, and removed the temporary hacks in the setAttribute() methods.
    So now coercions should work cleanly in Ant tasks. This should certainly fix bob's coercion problem he found when using <ant:property file="foo.properties"/>
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134919 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 0ad65130797ff99ef618c48c8fcb8dceb5816dbf
Author: Bob McWhirter <werken@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Jun 5 18:03:38 2002 +0000

    Added <jelly:import uri="location"/> which is semantically
    equivalent to <jelly:include uri="location" inherit="false" export="true"/>
    
    Like <include>, <import> allows the configuration of the 'inherit'
    attribute, which defaults to false.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134922 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit ac42719c0f5ace7b3bb7b145ff0c1a716c66d2d8
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Thu Jun 6 07:13:41 2002 +0000

    Added support for composite expressions in attribute values so that tags can be used as
    
    <foo "some text ${expr1} some more text ${expr2} more text">
    
    Along with test cases to check this works. Ultimately it might makes sense to push this down into Jexl. Currently there's no support for $ escaping like Velocity, so $${foo} won't escape the $.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134924 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit aab51b4a017640d4589c6859aa8f07017e920d9c
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Tue Jun 11 21:41:11 2002 +0000

    Added first cut of the Werkz tag library which implements goal orientated processing, not unlike Ant's <target> tags except there's full support for callbacks in a nice way.
    This could provide a nice mechanism for implementing flexible pre/post callbacks and introduce new dependency mechanisms in a Maven build from inside a project.
    
    Its not quite working yet, the <target> never gets fired, though the pre-callbacks do.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134935 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit b742b2ad5904d3eeafff7e7ca322d599c884ea95
Author: Bob McWhirter <werken@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Jun 12 17:09:41 2002 +0000

    * Improved handling of the <ant:echo> tag.
    
    * Integrated a prereq attribute on <goal>, like ant's depend attr on <target>.
    
    * Made example spiffy.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134946 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 73b6506a47bfb920f9f7d5c837496f7b5ee0bdb8
Author: Bob McWhirter <werken@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Jun 12 19:28:08 2002 +0000

    * Hacked in pertnear perfect whitespace trimming/handling.
      Any tag that inherits from TagSupport somewhere along the line
      now has the following properties:
    
        - A 'trim' attribute, taking 'true' or 'false'
    
        - If no 'trim' is set, then simply inherit from parent tag, or
          previous ancestor that has explicitly set a trim attribute.
    
        - TagSupport has a ctor that takes a boolean 'trim' parameter
          so that tags (or entire taglibs) may be marked as text-trimming
          or not.
    
        - The default response, if nothing set through ctor or trim attr
          is to *not trim*, which I think retains backwards compatibility.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134947 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 1760b746060d2809fcab9bf50f32f112ff74c76b

commit dfe4c4d1b86a96011ee84b9e7b6ffdbe4b987389
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Thu Jun 13 08:16:47 2002 +0000

    Removed unnecessary complication in ScriptBlock. I did add a List and an Array for speed but this led to complications in modifications to the List not being live. Have now removed the array so the list is live and things work more nicely.
    Removed the minor hack added to TagSupport.trim() to get around the problem in ScriptBlock.
    
    Defaulted whitespace trimming to true. Then any tag can explicitly turn off trimming via a trim="false" attribute.
    Also added the new <whitespace> tag which will preserve whitespace inside its body.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134955 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit cf58e7cf6f4bdd42a3df6bf33a3b76ca6e8a9eff
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Thu Jun 13 09:27:14 2002 +0000

    Added optional support for Ant style variable names.
    
    So ${foo.bar} will be evaluated first with Jexl. If there is a "foo" variable it will return the "bar" value.
    If this value is null, then it will try find the variable "foo.bar".
    
    This change means that Jelly can process existing Ant build.xml files, particularly the Maven ones. So its a backwards compatability thing really.
    
    Geir, this functionality could move back into Jexl at some point if you like. We can happily remove it from Jelly and put it into Jexl if you like.
    
    Also added test case for <whitespace> tag
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134956 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 640cd76cab5dc8cd71df3cb82358402a7229007c

    Improved test cases for Ant style variable expressions
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134957 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit a437999acb65212e5850bfb3198b9797f399456f
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Fri Jun 14 06:53:03 2002 +0000

    Patched Jelly so that expressions can now be both embedded inside attribute text as well as inside the body text.
    
    For example
    
    <foo value="text ${exp} text ${bean2.foo} text"/>
    
    or
    
    <foo>
            some text ${foo} text ${bar}
    </foo>
    
    both work fine now.
    
    Added some unit test cases for some new whitespace trimming code.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134962 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 3cadede6ec1c9c447827ac93c3b6a4cd9b79e9a9
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Fri Jun 14 10:24:14 2002 +0000

    Patched the Ant tag library so that Task objects are created for each tag invocation.
    This will avoid any problems of looping over a Task object since a Task in Ant often uses
    methods like addText() without ever clearing the text down; so it gives us a sure-fire way
    to know that the Task gets properly initialized each time.
    
    Also added generic support for the addText(String) method on Tasks using reflection such that
    a Tasks' body can be the text value; such as for <echo> or <sql>
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134963 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit f10ecf5b2ff938942f4f3400ecf3c30a18ea6d51
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Fri Jun 14 10:28:16 2002 +0000

    Patched to use the MethodUtils method from beanutils rather than the reflection methods on Class
    since throwing an exception when a method is not there is an unnecessary performance overhead.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134964 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 1fc502f277225fe2ada087e2dcda38968f9fa2c2
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Fri Jun 14 10:32:34 2002 +0000

    Deleted commented out code that was an old hack and is no longer required.

commit 13610cea63601a1a050a17c2969e255fffb6db0d
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Fri Jun 14 11:22:33 2002 +0000

    Tidied up some more examples, removing the redundant use of <j:expr value=, when just ${foo} will do now.
    
    Added a couple of Ant Project helper methods to the AntTagLibrary, to create Ant projects in a single place in the codebase.
    
    Also made the Werkz tag library use lazy construction for finding goals, so that a project.jelly can define pre-conditions/pre/post callbacks, then
    import a maven.jelly file to actually define all the goals and run the build.
    
    The 'demo.maven' target shows this in action, allowing a local project.jelly to just define the callbacks then invoke the main maven.jelly
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134967 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 2fe14459d49c656fcdc7a98f2685e3b4a614b2d6
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Tue Jun 18 12:27:24 2002 +0000

    Added a commons-logging tag library so that logging to either log4j, logkit or JDK1.4
    can easily be done from inside Jelly scripts, irrespective of the XML event pipeline.
    
    So for example debugging logging can be done in the middle of an XML transformation, without affecting the output result.

commit 904034b3e3796bb8878473c4246f3be7de1c808e
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Fri Jun 21 02:57:17 2002 +0000

    Added support for line and column numbering in exceptions that get generated so that its easy for users to see where in their scripts the typeos or problems originated.
    Going forward it might be nice to also include the file name that caused the problem as well.
    Also JellyException now properly handles nested exception stack traces now.
    There's a sample jelly script now for working with Ant that has some typos in it and Jelly reports the wrong line succesfully. For some reason the column number is -1 which could well be the SAX parser.

commit 8e08dc63df9dc1a0a197691631544309ed8c35ce
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Fri Jun 21 03:18:42 2002 +0000

    Provided factory methods for XMLOutput which does not escape XML output.
    This is useful for using XMLOutput in cases when the output is textual rather than XML
    such as when using Jelly inside Maven or Ant, where there is no need to escape '<' or '>' in output logs.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134985 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 760857eea7eb3176e20c2ac4b198cce2ac0cde34
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Sun Jun 23 01:29:34 2002 +0000

    Added the first cut of the validate tag library.
    This tag library is used to perform XML validation using a variety of schema languages such as DTDs, XML Schema, RelaxNG, Relax or TREX.
    The tag library uses the JARV API which abstracts away the details of different validation libraries and schemas and uses the MSV library from Sun as the default runtime implementation.
    
    The RelaxNG demo works fine though DTDs are not currently working yet.
    More work is required to support neat filtering (indeed we need to be able to construct Jelly-SAX-Filters using XMLFilter from SAX).
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134997 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 2cb2b80f5dc599476ea6024eec63590f62ab0d75
Author: Bob McWhirter <werken@apache.org>
Date:   Mon Jun 24 04:43:45 2002 +0000

    Allowing for descriptions and default targets.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134998 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 1cba6be96fb62d1d05defa409297a00b2111858e
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Mon Jun 24 11:17:09 2002 +0000

    First cut of the http tag library using commons-httpclient to script HTTP operations inside Jelly.
    Its not quite working yet but its close.
    
    When this library is working properly we should be able to use this to perform HTTP based SOAP scripting and unit testing.
    For example we should be able to do
    <babelfish:translate from="en" to="fr">Hello there my friend</babelfish:translate>
    
    and for the tag to do all the SOAP and HTTP malarkey inside the tag definition, which could be written in Jelly script itself.
    
    Similarly we could build macros for testing web applications. Maybe iterating over test data in XML documents to test that web applications perform properly.
    
    e.g.
    
    <x:forEach select="$tests/testcase">
            <x:set var="url" select="string(url)"/>
            <test:httpGet url="${url}" expects="100"/>
    
    etc.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@134999 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit a47e5ec78898ca9e721e9c4b2c8e5d0196536fe4

    It will allow us to maybe change the script-invocation protocol slightly, such as maybe making Tags on the stack in multi threaded servers, rather than instance data of the TagScript as it is right now

commit dc0a8931a41765ecd8a2041cefa51542e71502ed
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>

    allowed setAttribute() to throw an exception so that DynaTag errors can popup to the TagScript for better error reporting
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135011 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 0a6c53c891b3b4e9050b47bee442df029036b5d1
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Tue Jun 25 19:12:29 2002 +0000

    Added support for dynamic jelly beans. These are similar to <taskdef> in Ant
    but in this case any Java Bean can be bound to a Jelly tag then any 'invoke' method can be called.
    
    So for example any Runnable object can be dynamically bound into a dynamic tag library and invoked as a tag.
    The method could be run(), invoke(), execute() or whatever.
    The Jexl and tag attributes can set all the properties of the bean.
    
    So dynamic tag libraries can now be defined using regular beans or via jelly script.
    One more dynamic tag that uses a static method might be interesting to do...
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135012 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit b843d0f7a20b7afdef2c0e4e36237ed32c75da7a
Author: Bob McWhirter <werken@apache.org>
Date:   Tue Jun 25 20:43:30 2002 +0000

    Partial migration of all ant datatypes to OtherAntTag.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135013 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Jun 26 09:17:44 2002 +0000

    Added Vinay's <thread> tag which supports evaluating a block of Jelly script asynchronously in another thread.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135015 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 0d5aec147baa5b0b5399591c7e9dd775bb22bcb4
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Jun 26 09:24:36 2002 +0000

    Patched code to use the invokeBody(output) method instead of the getBody().run(context, output) mechanism.
    This allows us to put common whitespace trimming code inside the invokeBody() method as well as isolating us from the Script interface, which going forward might change a little bit to, for example, pass the parent Tag into child TagScripts, so that Tag instances can stay on the stack, in local threads, for multi threaded server applications.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135016 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit ce248088261b445aa958302ac1afafe4c17feef1
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Jun 26 09:43:31 2002 +0000

    Patched the use of invokeBody() so it actually works now ;-). Also thanks to these changes the
    setTrim(false) now works on any Jelly tag.
    
    <forEach trim="false" ...>
            no whitespace trimming here....
    </forEach>
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135017 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit fec8a5b7bd8190cbb22a9075362ec74f89c9eab0
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Jun 26 11:46:45 2002 +0000

    added some debug logging
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135018 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 7323c912c288a68c2065e2d8579b8a297f9471c4
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Jun 26 13:09:09 2002 +0000

    Patched the Ant tag library so that the body of an Ant task is run before the attributes are set on the Ant Task.
    This seems to get round some problems with certain Ant Tasks where they
    expect their body context to be initialised before they are configured.
    For example setErrorProperty() on a JUnitTask will assume that all the test cases will have been added to the task before the setter is called.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135019 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 92a09930ea0b2e7e7e3b8025d3306e4e891eaaec
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Jun 26 14:50:44 2002 +0000

    Patched the <forEach> tag so that it works for simple numerical for loops.
    Also added the <file> tag which will generate a file of the given name with the contents of its body, which is good for generating multiple files from inside a Jelly script
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135020 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 22193e8805fd206f0d1f1936316598add41692b7
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Fri Jun 28 12:13:27 2002 +0000

    Changed the code along similar lines as Vinay's patch so that exceptions now carry the file name, the tag name and the line & column number of the error.
    This makes things much easier to debug when working wtih multiple files, such as Maven etc.
    
    One thing to watch though; right now this assumes that the Jelly script is parsed from a URI or File so that it know where the source is. Using a Reader or InputStream will not work as the parser doen't know where the script comes from.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135029 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 04a298546d20f4586827fd37916d2a3311ca7cd9
Author: Stephane Mor <smor@apache.org>
Date:   Sat Jul 13 00:49:45 2002 +0000

    I added an AskTag, in an InteractionTagLibrary, so that Jelly
    scripts can retrieve variables from the user.
    
    The AskTag is used as :
    <ask question="Your question"
         answer="interaction.ask.answer"
         default="Default answer"/>
    
    You can then <echo>${interaction.ask.answer}</echo>.
    If there is no input, it will be "Default answer".
    
    This is useful to set variables dynamically from the user.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135055 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit fcfc4adfcfc73f61a187459e8dc6cb4d83aba028
Author: Peter Lynch <plynch@apache.org>
Date:   Sat Jul 13 01:03:27 2002 +0000

    o Now supports returning an iterator from a collection
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135056 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit c6706cc07e428d02ce34ade70d940c9d5b0b7e1e
Author: Stephane Mor <smor@apache.org>
Date:   Sun Jul 14 01:25:01 2002 +0000

    Added the InteractionTagLibrary to the known optional taglibs.
    This allows to refer to the TagLibrary with :
    xmlns:i="jelly:interaction".
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135057 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 599a3d118f2250277e0eedad1d049bf1708074ce
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Mon Jul 15 11:40:10 2002 +0000

    Now using patched version of dom4j so that we output namespace declarations on static content in a Jelly script.
    This should fix dIon's recent issue with SOAP namespaces.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135062 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

      can see what's set and what's not set. This let me figure out what was
      wrong with a bunch of dynamic maven jelly beans. Shouldn't cost anything
      as it only occurs when the invocation fails.

commit fdb1f6fb10ca21a628e675896df1f3c8fa46ddf2
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Jul 17 17:38:25 2002 +0000

    * Added support for <define:attribute> qualifiers in <define:jellybean> tag so that default values can be specified, or attributes can be marked as being required.
    
    * also <define:jellybean> now expects an invoke method to be specified, otherwise an exception is thrown
    
    * the new <define:bean> tag allows regular java beans to be created and bound to a variable, which is useful for entity based beans such as working with OJB or parsing config files etc.
    
    There are examples of the above, try running
    
            maven demo:bean
            maven demo:jellybean
    
    and it will make much more sense.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135075 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 70c9336c261b4455002488fd8b7ca3292e475fb7
Author: Stephane Mor <smor@apache.org>
Date:   Fri Jul 19 22:07:34 2002 +0000

    Added a "dist:install" goal to install Jelly on the user's system.
    This creates a ${maven.dist.install.dir} dir, and copies all the files
    needed by Jelly to run (which are generated in "dist:build"'s preGoal.
    
    Though, I can't generate the JELLY_HOME and the PATH, so I added a
    big warning telling the user that he needs to set those variables.
    
    Note : I defaulted the ${maven.dist.install.dir} to /usr/local/jelly,
    which is a Linux path. I should add a system detection, so that
    both worlds are happy :)
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135079 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 98afe6062831d16829092100e385afd8d2a30b99
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Fri Jul 19 22:19:32 2002 +0000

    Added a HTML Jelly library so that regular HTML documents can be parsed and then processed via Jelly, via XPath etc.
    
    This library uses Andy Clark's excellent  NekoHTML SAX parser

commit 3e62aca21310496caaa2d93dfde58e5d3cf211a3
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Fri Jul 19 23:03:01 2002 +0000

    Patched the HTML parser so that the default behaviour is to preserve case of the HTML tags, using the first tag as the decider if the cases are different.
    
    Also created a demo to show how the NekoHTML parser can handle plain text too; so we could use this mechanism to parse text files containing Jelly script
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135082 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit cdbd983935f8946ba57d316c57da64659eb0914b

Date:   Fri Jul 19 23:05:21 2002 +0000

    Adding early version of the <tagdef> tag for use in Maven. commit 4c3bc34776208be0f7c332b3580b52b41ab32cd0
Author: Peter Lynch <plynch@apache.org>
Date:   Sat Jul 20 07:55:16 2002 +0000

    o adding a workaround for Ant 1.5 <manifest> task. IN Ant 1.4.1 manifest was only inside a jar task. In Ant 1.5 it can also be standalone. Couldn't find a better way to detect this than checking the tagname. If the check is not there, processing fails because it treats it as the manifest attribute of the jar task and complains about "file" attribute being required.
    
    This change should unaffect ant 1.4.1 users.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135085 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 6f81c505e175c6521c3e0ab029c39977575a60af
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Sat Jul 20 08:12:04 2002 +0000

    Added the core features of a JUnit library for Jelly.
    
    So usual JUnit style operations can be performed in an Ant script such as..
    
    <assert test="${foo.bar != null}">oh dear its broken</assert>
    
    or XPath assertions
    
    <assert xpath="/foo/bar[count(beer) != 0]">bar is dry!</assert>
    
    or a helper for testing equality
    
    <assertEquals actual="${foo}" expected="${xyz}"/>
    
    <fail>this test has failed</fail>
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135086 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit f70c820b2758fe38a05dddae3e258e142714e57c
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Mon Jul 22 07:16:52 2002 +0000

    Enhanced the JUnit tag library so that TestSuite and TestCase objects can be created in Jelly script so that unit testing becomes easy to do via Jelly scripts.
    This also means that Jelly can be integrated easily into existing test runners.
    
    See the src/test/org/apache/commons/jelly/junit/ directory for details of how this works; there you'll find a suite.jelly which is the test suite and a TestJUnit.java class which is a simple class to bind the suite.jelly into Ant's default JUnit test runner.
    This class should be usable in any JUnit test runner, since it provides a class with a static suite() method, yet internally it uses one or more Jelly scripts to actually create the individual TestCase objects.
    
    So the new JellyUnit capabilities can be seamlessly integrated with traditional Java test cases. So users can now use either Java or Jelly; intermixing the two to use the best tool for the job. So now Jelly could be used for XML, SOAP, SQL, HTTP & JMS testing and such like.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135087 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit fe144e64fc6125e9a9cc7eae78ee8d49e604fec1
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Tue Jul 23 12:52:44 2002 +0000

    Added a simple Swing library for Jelly which means that Swing UIs can be scripted very easily via Jelly script.
    
    To get a taste for how this library works, try running the 'demo:swing' target in the Maven build by typing
    
            maven demo:swing
    
    and you should see a full Swing UI appear.
    
    It could be that this library could help form the basis of implementing XUL on the Swing platform?
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135104 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit a966695bc9605861e22d613b17277af631ccfbf3
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Jul 24 17:34:43 2002 +0000

    Added support for nested <action> tags in the JellySwing library so that inside common widgets such as <menuItem> or <button> an Action can be specified, which can even use Jelly script to invoke itself, such as to make a new widget / view appear etc.
    Moving forward, maybe much of UIs glue/controller code could just be Jelly script, then we focus just on building the Models and use XML/Jelly for the View and Controllers?
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135107 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit df1705ea5a98e745110163e4264318bb7e0f153d
Author: Bob McWhirter <werken@apache.org>
Date:   Thu Jul 25 01:51:21 2002 +0000

    Added quartz (http://quartz.sf.net/) taglib.
    
    <job>, <trigger>, and <wait-for-scheduler> are now available
    in the jelly:quartz namespace.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135108 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 5a7f74c19545653462eb2c1acc6aceaac383a301
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Thu Aug 1 09:53:19 2002 +0000

    Patched the Script implementation mechanism for 2 reasons
    
    (i) to try make a single Script instance cacheable and multi-threaded so that in server side deployments, the scripts can be cached and reused across multiple threads to boost performance and lower RAM usage
    
    (ii) to introduce the TagFactory so that a tag can be bound to a Tag instance at runtime, rather than just at parse time.
    This makes many things much simpler, particularly in the area of dynamic tags.
    
    For example the Jeez library unifies the define tag library with the ant tag library, both of which can create dynamic tags, at run time.
    Until this change was done, it was not possible to return a single efficient Tag implementation at parse time. So now at parse time a TagLibrary can create a TagFactory which at runtime decides which Tag instance to use.
    This chance helps the multi-threaded nature also, so that different threads can create their own tag implemention.
    
    
    Right now the current policy is for a Script object to be reusable across threads (which needs testing), then each thread will create & cache 1 Java object per tag on the page. Each Tag is cached in ThreadLocal storage. If a Script goes out of scope then all this should be GC'd.
    So we've a neat, simple,  multi-threaded, pooled solution that should cause minimum object allocation yet allow flexible bean style coding and not require byte code generation (and all the classloading / GC issues that entails).
    
    Also for the Maven users, the <tagdef> is now working and can be used inside Maven now, which simplifies things greatly - no need to create a new tag library & new tag, just use <tagdef> and add a new tag dynamically to the maven (Jeez) tag library.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135120 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit f0b2449c54e8c5694df5fc7cbe34a90cc7c64d34
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Thu Aug 1 10:09:30 2002 +0000

    minor patch to make the demo:tagdef demo a little cleaner; though this demo only works with a recent build of CVS HEAD of Maven, since its demonstrating the use of <tagdef> inside Maven, rather than spawning another JVM and using the local Jelly build.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135121 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 3a5dba4b6c035e2eabd4ce682f178cf4269f0c0e
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Tue Aug 13 08:04:38 2002 +0000

    Patch so that Tag instances stay around after the run() method has been invoked. This allows tags to work properly when asynchronous excecution takes place or if dynamic scripts or tags are used, where they may invoke after their parent's run() method has been called.
    
    This should finally fix the last of the bugs introduced by making Script objects shareable across threads and Tag instances pooled per thread.
    
    Also for good measure, added a new demo:werkz target that demonstrates the werkz tag library in action.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135149 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit fe3e72421df243fbcb5707602fd9a531460c9139
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Thu Aug 15 07:56:11 2002 +0000

    Added an <assertValid> tag which can be used in JellyUnit scripts to assert that a section of XML is valid according to some XML Schema, RelaxNG, Relax or TREX.
    DTDs should work too, as MSV supports that too I think, but isn't quite working yet.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135152 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 06b1266bc6965962f8a34ca13ab4e5d7671f4e02
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Thu Aug 15 11:17:58 2002 +0000

    Patch to allow DTD validation to work as well as XML Schema, RelaxNG, Relax and TREX.
    This trick is that to detect a DTD the MSV library needs the systemID to be defined and to end in .dtd otherwise the schema is assumed to be in XML format and the namespaces are used to determine which schema language it is.
    MSV is pretty neat stuff!
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135153 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 63f23f0357cc3523f73779d40cd6f0654280fa2d
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Thu Aug 15 11:18:51 2002 +0000

    Added unit test to test DTD validation using <assertValid> tag inside JellyUnit.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135154 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 1506622b0c37b525d805f51cef901bdcfb2bd5db
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Thu Aug 15 16:16:53 2002 +0000

    Patched to use Ant 1.5.
    Also removed the local copy of Ant's IntrospectionHelper that was added as a temporary hack.
    
    Added a patch for Ant tags which can be both a Task and a nested object.
    For example the <manifest> tag can be a ManifestTask if used by itself, of if it is embedded inside a <jar> Task then the Jar.addConfiguredManifest() is called instead.
    This fixes the manifest bug that was introduced by the move of Maven to Ant 1.5.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135155 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 6f4ba7bb0dd684db1af46d55703f99842700dcf0
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Thu Aug 15 16:39:34 2002 +0000

    Patch for bug
    
    http://jira.werken.com:8181/ViewIssue.jspa?key=JELLY-3
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135156 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>

    added latest Maven-generated Ant build file
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135162 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 063c05049aa588acbd4cb0e8970b3c7e0351ffff
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Mon Aug 19 16:15:21 2002 +0000

    Patch so that in JellyUnit, each <test:case> has its own variable scope, so that JellyUnit test cases cannot step on each others toes.
    
    Note that the scope for each <test:case> is a child of the <test:suite> scope, so that global variables can be shared, per <test:suite> across individual <test:case> test cases.
    e.g.
    
    <test:suite>
       <!-- define some global variables... -->
      <j:set var="g" value="abc"/>
    
      <test:case>
    
         <!-- variables I define will be local -->
        <j:set var="foo" value="1234"/>
    
         // however I can refer to global variable ${g} if required
        ...
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135163 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit eb75f2cd825ae9bd7347a9065a7210456b9a04f1
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Mon Aug 19 16:30:05 2002 +0000

    Patch so that child contexts can register new tag libraries, or even override which tag library is active for a given URI, without affectiing the parent context.
    This is a similar pattern to allow child variable scopes to be local and not affect the parent scope
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135164 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 145e959460227ffd314c21467f588a1f8416d31a
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Mon Aug 19 20:36:23 2002 +0000

    Patch so that any XML element in the Ant/Maven namespace that does not map to an Ant tag will be output as regular static XML.
    This allows static XML and Ant/Maven tags all to coexist within the same namespace
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135165 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit fae057085b7dc73d441c5a05afd4508a88b83529
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Mon Aug 19 21:38:09 2002 +0000

    Patched minor bug that dynamic tags would often not be on the parent hierarchy
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135166 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 01d84acfc6432a79ad4b90671887b9668b92af49
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Mon Aug 19 21:38:56 2002 +0000

    Added support for BeanSource interface, so that you can walk up the tree asking for the beans for <define:bean>, <define:jellybean> style of tags.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135167 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 5f1d54d2343b2c9102f60a5c28b5e002a3b93645
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Mon Aug 19 21:42:03 2002 +0000

    Added support for Ant style adder and setter methods that can be used either on a Jelly Tag implementation or on a regular Java Bean that is bound to a dynamic tag via either <define:bean> or <define:jellybean>
    
    So you can write a tag or bean like this
    
    public MyTag extends TagSupport {
        public void setFileset(FileSet fileSet);
    
        // or
    
        public void addFileset(FileSet fileSet);
    }
    
    which can then take nested (say) <fileset> Ant properties etc.
    
    To see this in action, try the demo:jellybean Maven target which demonstrates the use of this technique.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135168 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

    setting escape/unescape mode.  Should we actually inherit from.. where?

commit 3f84b6b7b1447a8a6eb7395fb8518efbf86b51db
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Fri Aug 23 10:29:18 2002 +0000

    Patched so that by default new tag libraries will percolate up the parent context stack unless explicitly disabled.
    
    The JellyUnit <test:case> disables all exporting of variables and tag libraries up the parent stack so that test cases cannot interfere with each other.
    
    This should hopefully fix the problems that were introduced that Stephen Haberman found.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135174 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 009cb1390877138b9d845a10dfcc4e0c277b3c3c
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>

    Added support for <define:dynabean/> that can bind a tag to a new DynaBean instance.
    This is similar to the <define:bean/> mechanism but just the DynaBean alternative. It allows DynaClasses to be created using the <dynabean:dynaclass> tag then bound to an element in XML for easy population.

commit 9672c34c43518059651ce8670f5a62dd455fdaae
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Tue Sep 17 15:28:24 2002 +0000

    Allow the test name to be defaulted to the default TestSuite created by the <test:suite> tag
    
    Also allow a TestListener to be specified via the listener="" attribute.
    The listener defaults to a simple listener which outputs the results as XML events, which can be consumed and processed by the parent tag/script

commit 7e38090238daf314df0f6db5a497c6a14b1f9057
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Sep 18 18:47:17 2002 +0000

    Patched the JMS tag library to better support easy destinations via an optional subject="a.b.c" attribute.
    
    Also improved the error reporting somewhat
    
    Finally added a subscribe tag that can be useful for Messagelets (from Commons Messenger) style subscriptions from inside Jelly. e.g.
    
    <connection name="foo">
    
      <subscribe subject="my.queue" messageListener="${whatever}"/>
    
      <subscribe subject="my.queue" selector="a='xyz'" messageListener="${whatever}"/>
    
      <subscribe subject="my.queue">
            <myCustomTagThatMakesAMessageListener/>
    
      </subscribe>
    
    
    etc.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135213 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit d6a4de37ec5a3ca421a9497946bdfc43a77a69e2
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Sep 18 18:47:56 2002 +0000

    incremented the pre-release snapshot build number
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135214 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 9669ddf78f524049acde8c59f154c011d18efb6b
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Fri Sep 20 13:15:16 2002 +0000

    Added support for evaluateAsValue() which (though I don't like the name) will evaluate any nested expressions.
    
    The evaluateAsString(), evaluateAsIterator() and evaluateAsBoolean() methods now use this new method.
    
    The reason for this is that sometimes an expression may evaluate to be an Expression object. So the evaluateAsValue() will evaluate the expression, then if the result is another Expression it will keep evaluating it, recursively until its not an Expression.
    
    Care should be taken when making infinite Expression nesting!
    
    The reason for this fix is that often Maven will populate the Maven JellyContext with variables which are Expressions (rather than the values of the expressions). So that ${maven.foo} when evaluated would lookup the value of 'maven.foo', which could return an Expression.
    This change will hopefully provide auto-unwrapping of these 'nested expressions'
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135215 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 55e94775a96c01324139fee6388c9bf6972b06f6

    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135216 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit bf5a5207ec725a4b8203414f5e48423830082a53
Author: Peter Lynch <plynch@apache.org>
Date:   Sun Sep 22 09:16:49 2002 +0000

    o it is possible that an AntTag attribute may contain a composite expression. The old code simply called the toString on such an object which printed whatever the toString of the CompositeExpression gives which is gobblygook - instead now we use the new evaluateAsValue method to hopefully get something more useful - I can't think of a case where this would be bad and it plays better with maven so I add this fix
    o trimmed some line endings
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135220 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit b217a34e44eaa7bca08788c5d3a2f2af2650931e
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Mon Sep 23 12:35:42 2002 +0000

    Added a new <setProperty> tag which allows properties to be set on the parent Ant task which are ignored if the expression is empty. This provides better handling of configurable properties on Ant Tasks when using Maven plugins.
    
    e.g.
    
    <jmxdoclet>
        <setProperty name="destdir" value="${maven.xdoclet.jmxdoclet.destdir}"/>
    </jmxdoclet>
    
    The <setProperty> tag can also take an optional default you want to code in your plugin (to override the Ant task default).
    
    e.g.
    
    <jmxdoclet>
        <setProperty name="destdir" value="${maven.xdoclet.jmxdoclet.destdir}" default="{0}Home"/>
    </jmxdoclet>
    
    If the value expression of <setProperty> is null then the property is not set, preserving the underlying default in the Ant task.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135221 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 78b0ad5dba25ab01e4f2132d98f814f0f4700100
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Tue Sep 24 10:55:59 2002 +0000

    Added support for a <j:setProperties> tag which can make creating beans and setting properties on them much simpler.
    e.g.
    
    <j:new var="customer" className="com.acme.MyCustomer"/>
    <j:setProperties object="${customer}" name="James" location="London" orders="${foo.findOrders()}"/>
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135222 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 9c161c08f701003b5d101302d5f308d08675bbf6
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Tue Sep 24 11:04:56 2002 +0000

    Added support for a <j:setProperties> tag which can make creating beans and setting properties on them much simpler.
    e.g.
    
    <j:new var="customer" className="com.acme.MyCustomer"/>
    <j:setProperties object="${customer}" name="James" location="London" orders="${foo.findOrders()}"/>
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135223 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 434ee80e8d46a09e9d95cf9aff0290352d0c0031
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Tue Sep 24 11:39:50 2002 +0000

    Added a <j:useBean> tag to both mimick the similar JSP tag but also to combine it with the <j:setProperties> tag so that a fully configured bean can be created easily by a single tag.
    
    <j:useBean var="foo" class="com.acme.MyCustomer" name="James" location="London" role="Hacker"/>
    
    Where the above will create a new variable called 'foo' of type com.acme.MyCustomer and then will set the name, location and role properties to the values given.
    
    This tag is also useful as a base class for constructing arbitrary objects of certain kinds that can be configured and used in some script - such as to plug in arbitrary Actions into a workflow style script or in a simple testing framework etc.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135224 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit b3da0b9ba4832a660dbd171131186ed15a221d54
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Tue Sep 24 16:48:54 2002 +0000

    Refactored some of the code for JellySwing to reuse the new UseBeanTag which simplifies the code quite a bit.
    This also allows JellySwing widgets to be customized such as
    
            <table class="com.acme.MyTable" model="${mymodel}"/>
    
    Cleaned up the code so that either widgets/models are created and added to the parent widget, or they are just exported as a variable if the 'var' attribute is specified.
    
    Also added an introductory <font> implementation. Though the createFont() factory method doesn't seem to work very well :-(
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135225 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 5a3d6ed26ae2fec939d530017f1b70435e916125

Date:   Wed Sep 25 06:41:12 2002 +0000

    tidied up the cvsignore file...

commit cfb5cf4530bf49184410162c2f0e050c2372eeaa
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Sep 25 08:37:51 2002 +0000

    Applied Robert Leftwich's excellent patches to add full support for <x:transform> for executing XSLT on some XML.
    The XML or the XSLT can come from the tags body just like the <x:transform> tag in JSTL.
    
    Ultimately this tag can be used to implement sophisticated XSLT pipelining such as...
    
    <x:transform xslt="a.xsl">
        <x:transform xslt="b.xsl">
            <foo>
                <bar name="${some.expression}"/>
            </foo>
        </x:transform>
    </x:transform>
    
    which can then be used in association with servlet engines, SOAP services or just generating static content.
    
    It'd be nice to optimize the implementation at some point so that it can work totally on SAX in the above example. But this is an awesome start.
    
    Also do check out the groovy unit test cases such as the Schematron examples. It'd be nice to maybe generate a native Jelly implementaiton of Schematron...
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135229 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit d5515a05450e8aec8dcb876af6b31849824838a8
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Sep 25 16:26:16 2002 +0000

    Added support for LayoutManagers to JellySwing. This is vital to providing form like JellySwing front ends.
    
    This patch includes numerous patches kindly supplied by a new contributor, Paul Libbrecht. There is also support for a new Colour converter to more easily work with colors.
    
    There are 2 primary layouts supported right now.
    
    The first is a HTML style <tableLayout> <tr> <td> style approach which all HTML or XHTML developers will be accustomed to.
    It allows you to create Swing forms like this...
    
    <panel>
    <tableFormat>
        <tr>
            <td colspan="2">
                <label text="hello"/>
            </td>
            <td align="center" valign="bottom">
                ...
                <textField text="whatever"/>
            </td>
    
    
    The second layouts are provided by Paul and implement full support for GridBagLayouts and their constraints with added support for inheritence of settings from parent/child constraints.
    
    <gridBagLayout>
            <gbc x="0" y="1" weightx="12">
                    <panel>
    
    etc.
    
    The demo that can be run via
    
            maven demo:swing
    
    Uses by default the tableLayout approach. Then if you click on the Demo menu you can run a sample using the <gridBagLayout> approach.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135230 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit e5ecdbaafa92d7dc304636107a12162a1acde0f2
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Sep 25 17:54:57 2002 +0000

    Patch to demonstrate the use of dialogs in JellySwing.
    
    The new demo
    
            maven demo:swing
    
    now has an about dialog box as well as a Jelly script runner. This lets you leave the Swing UI running and then you can fire off any Jelly script you wish using a file dialog.
    While the program is running you can keep re-evaluating Jelly scripts.
    This makes a large benefit for edit-compile-run cycles. So as you edit Jelly scripts you can just click run to run them. No need to wait for the JVM and Maven to startup
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135231 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 49f34a3f51e911ded61b2cd86da59202c091077c

Date:   Wed Sep 25 18:36:59 2002 +0000

    Added Otto's groovy demo that shows how Jelly can be used as a templating system.
    
    To run it type
    
            maven demo:embed

commit c46348752956d69148fd5af041d98fab38bc521a
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Thu Sep 26 12:28:21 2002 +0000

    Added support in the <x:transform> tag so that output can be SAX events. This allows more efficient SAX based XSLT pipelines.
    
    So if users don't want to parse the output of the XSLT, they can just pipe it out as SAX events.
    
    Also added a test case of this.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135233 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 705c159c5778016d485b030b389e9599e9bc6a2f
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Thu Sep 26 18:07:37 2002 +0000

    Some JellySwing changes.
    
    Firstly added support for <borderLayout> and <borderAlign align="center"> style of tags to use the Swing BorderLayout.
    Added support for <vbox> and <hbox> to create Swing Box panels (which have their own inbuilt BoxLayout)
    
    Also added colfill="true" and rowfill="true" options on <td> so that columns can stretch
    
    Finally I've improved the JellyRunner so that its a little dialog, with a history field and a button so that reevaluating the same script can be much easier. Just hit save in your editor and hit the button and the Jelly script executes immediately - no more waiting for a JVM to start.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135234 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit fa853183aa430fe4a2d8c66d398aafd718b0493b
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Mon Sep 30 08:05:45 2002 +0000

    Applied Robert Leftwich's patches to support efficent SAX based XSLT pipelines via nested <x:transform> tags. Groovy stuff!
    This turns Jelly into a flexible, fast XSLT pipeline engine! Nice work Robert!
    There's still a couple of issue to work out but this is looking really neat
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135246 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 6b3ebb36246d4ec481d1d246df4b4f6f945e99ec
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Mon Sep 30 08:06:59 2002 +0000

    Applied patch suggested by Martin Cooper that evaluateRecurse() was a much better name than evaluateAsValue() which was pretty crappy. (Sometimes I have a mental block of what to call things and this was a great example of that mental block! :-)
    Thanks for the suggestion Martin.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135247 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit faafb3c9d396b1586f91acc92d5af276bf5f366a
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Mon Sep 30 17:30:28 2002 +0000

    Patched code to match comments made by Kevin Jones and Steve Downey that the result set should always be closed before the statement.
    
    I think that now (finally) the closing and exception handling of the SQL tags is working correctly. Though I stand corrected if anyone can find another bug here! :-)
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135248 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit b4542deee71ae05b7e4049c3186bebe7369bf82e
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Mon Sep 30 17:31:39 2002 +0000

    Added a comment to the code on the point raised by Kevin Jones and Steve Downey on the order of closing of result set & statement
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135249 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 2c4c1b4b22796e1f81f1e11e98fcfb1444cd005a
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Mon Sep 30 17:35:20 2002 +0000

    commented out the DTD so that this unit test will work in offline mode
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135250 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit e539740035e27834236713ee7446fe78ff527588
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Mon Sep 30 17:36:16 2002 +0000

    Added some extra debugging code so that the toString() correctly reports the expression text
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135251 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 928a4945402493779ad10c64415d0d57b43d65ee
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Mon Sep 30 17:38:16 2002 +0000

    Minor patch so that DynaTag objects can declare the types of their dynamic properties to facilitate better expression type coercion.
    
    For example a DynaTag might have an attribute which is of type Expression which the DynaTag wishes to evaluate however it wishes without it just being turned into an Object.
    So this method allows DynaTag objects to return, for example, that an attribute is of type Expression.class allowing them to coerce the Expression themselves.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135252 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 9d1530f438906ec7b7ac3c5af44b9e45e2d83716
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Mon Sep 30 17:40:16 2002 +0000

    Improved the reusability of the <useBean> tag so that it can be subclassed and default to a regular implementation class. This makes derivations of UseBeanTag easier to write.
    
    Also added a simple <useList> tag which simplifies the creation and use of Lists. For example to create a new List from some arbitarary collection/enumeration/array/iterator you can do things like
    
    <useList var="mylist" values="${foo.iterator()}"/>
    ${mylist[2]}
    
    etc.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135253 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 1887ddcafde09a882030123d170ecddc53f46db3
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Mon Sep 30 17:46:59 2002 +0000

    Removed some unnecessary debugging code and patched to make use of the new getAttributeType() method of DynaTag so that a DynaTag can work with native Expression objects and perform its own coercion.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135254 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 83c638617ff3f7870338b900eb94f2c235b1dbb6
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Mon Sep 30 17:52:28 2002 +0000

    Added support in JellySwing for simple TableModels which use any pluggable Jelly Expressions for defining the columns.
    
    This allows any List of objects to be easily rendered in a table in JellySwing without any programming involved. Its hoped this kind of thing could be ported to SWT too!
    
    A simple example has been added which will display all the variables in the current context in a table.
    This could be improved somewhat, but shows that a List of property names can be displayed in a table, showing the value, type, row index and the name of the variable; all powered by a List of Strings.
    
    Another good demo could be to render a table of beans (such as some Maven POM objects) in a table.
    Or to use commons-beanutils or commons-sql to get some DynaBeans and render those in a table using expressions.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135255 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit e3cbf26743612a7524b30dda571d2355f36f2860
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Mon Sep 30 17:59:38 2002 +0000

    Regenerated the Ant build file to take into account recent changes in dependencies.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135256 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 13e4c09682bd625f19fcf013ca11ee6878fa06c6
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Tue Oct 1 16:11:24 2002 +0000

    Applied Jason Horman's patches to add support in BeanShell for modifying Jelly's context as well as adding a new <script> tag
    
    <script>
            System.out.println("hello there" + foo):
    </script>
    
    Also refactored a little bit the use of the JellyInterpreter for BeanShell so that one is associated with the JellyContext rather than having an evil static.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135257 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

    Applied Jason Horman's patches to add support in BeanShell for modifying Jelly's context as well as adding a new <script> tag
    
    <script>
            System.out.println("hello there" + foo):
    </script>
    
    Also refactored a little bit the use of the JellyInterpreter for BeanShell so that one is associated with the JellyContext rather than having an evil static.

commit d1f02e5debd5e43bea8250639969a453cf9015d6
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Tue Oct 1 16:45:23 2002 +0000

    Added patch to <j:file> so that a variable can be specified instead of a file name and the body will be turned into a variable string.
    
    Its not a brilliantly named tag but the following could generate some XML as a String
    
    <j:file var="foo">
            <some>
                    <x m="l"/>
            </some>
    <j:file>
    I now have a value ${foo}
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135259 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 8d14a675d270af36b20ff0caea17233d706204b5

Date:   Wed Oct 2 11:03:38 2002 +0000

    Applied Jim Birchfield's patches to support both a jelly.properties file when running Jelly from the command line as well as a new <properties> tag to load properties from a file or URI in Jelly script.

commit 3160efff3cee7ee8cc0accc95e1b38151bb9df4f
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
