    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135262 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit e433f2c6dac66c398d153bce609a519adca94457
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Oct 2 16:07:27 2002 +0000

    Added a simple utility tag that allows a text file to be loaded into a variable as a String.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135263 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit e69643235f1a6ed6fcfa685024ad0849c6f07a96
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Oct 2 16:39:26 2002 +0000

    Allow the logging tags to specify whether their body should be XML encoded as text or not.
    
    By default the body is now not encoded. So if you did
    
    <log:info>hello <b>there</b> how are you?</log:info>
    
    You'd actually get the following message in your log...
    
    hello <b>there</b> how are you?
    
    rather than the XML encoded version with &lt; and &gt; etc.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135264 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 3f849840d9d192fe374c0573ac69c211cc91f56c
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Oct 2 16:55:04 2002 +0000

    Added support for the <j:set> tag to set the value of a String variable to its body without XML-encoding the XML as text.
    
    So that
    
    <j:set var="foo" encode="false">
            <some>xml</some>
    </j:set>
    
    Would generate a String "       <some>xml</some>" rather than encoding the < and > characters.
    
    I've preserved the current behaviour, that the default should be to encode; though maybe we should change the default? It was fear of braking code that stopped me do it.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135265 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit e5fe7ef4b07af82a4a83a41f7cfcae617fe42594
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Thu Oct 3 07:05:38 2002 +0000

    After Morgan's suggestion, added some javadoc comments about threading
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135266 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 6d83d402b71db9f28901e6304dc0143d0717e7e8
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Thu Oct 3 07:52:37 2002 +0000

    Added a <j:remove var="foo"/> tag to remove variables as well as a <j:scope> tag which creates a new variable scope for its body.
    So the following can be performed...
    
    <jelly>
    
        <scope>
            <set var="var1" />
            <useBean var="var2" />
        </scope>
    
        <!-- var1 and var2 no longer exist -->
    
    </jelly>
    
    Many thanks to Jason Horman for the idea.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135267 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 8638d31725de5ac786d6b403402907e83d8ffd67
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Thu Oct 3 18:14:44 2002 +0000

    Applied patches to merge TagScript, BeanTagScript and DynaTagScript together into a single class.
    
    This makes the implementation much simpler, it allows tags to dynamically be created by a TagLibrary that may be a bean Tag or a DyanTag.
    It also simplifies the job of keeping the Script implementations all thread safe.
    BeanTagScript was prematurely optimised which wasn't thread safe.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135268 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit e61c5fddcc9d9d445947bffd5addd3dcdd8ae5ac
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Fri Oct 4 11:28:20 2002 +0000

    Committed patches submitted by Jason Horman to provide a decent command line interface using commons-cli to Jelly.
    
    So usage is like this...
    Usage: jelly [scriptFile] [-script scriptFile -o outputFile  -Dsysprop=syspropval]
    
    Additional command line options are available in jelly scripts by using the
    commandLine.getOptionValue(optionName) method. Args is also still available.
    
    context.setVariable("args", args);
    context.setVariable("commandLine", cmdLine);
    
    
    Also there's a sample target to demonstrate this in action. Type
    
            maven demo:cmdline
    
    and you'll see Jason's test script run, using beanshell in a Jelly script to display the options and system properties etc.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135269 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 5ceb4e03653e3ccb49dcdc0721371fedef45d1bb

commit 7b664f3ec06b6375d78f050178306ae52a911600
Author: Jeff Turner <jefft@apache.org>
Date:   Sat Oct 5 13:21:13 2002 +0000

    flush() the output stream instead of close()'ing it. Closing System.out isn't a
    good idea :) and in general, the owner of a stream should control it's
    lifecycle, not 3rd party code.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135274 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

Date:   Mon Oct 7 15:02:49 2002 +0000

commit 937eeea0525250246f83aeb1b3cbf028238b6f49

Date:   Tue Oct 8 09:20:10 2002 +0000

    Patch to use a new child context for the asynchronous execution.
    Also this ensures that the asynchronous block will definitely contain the correct context, irrespectively of what happens to the ThreadTag after it is disposed of after evaluation.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135277 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit c8b44e1979ddfc14f647677de8c6d5285b917a08
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Tue Oct 8 11:26:00 2002 +0000

    Patches to fix Vincent's problem when trying to invoke goals asynchronously in other threads. This seems to work fine now.
    
    Added helper tag, <util:sleep millis="1000"/> to be able to get one thread to sleep for a certain time. Adding some kind of <waitFor> would be much more appropriate instead.
    
    Also there's a sample of this in action via
    
      maven demo:async
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135278 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit d26e53e5f809d5c73834b0c12d6f6ed70b8100a0
Author: Bob McWhirter <werken@apache.org>
Date:   Tue Oct 8 20:22:13 2002 +0000

    Reducing output when an exception goes flying by.
    
    Tossing an exception is a perfectly valid (non-erroneous) method
    of flow-control manipulation within jelly, and shouldn't be logged
    as an error from TagScript.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135279 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit e6dd74f271f6b9dffd94657b210d88188969ae23
Author: Jeff Turner <jefft@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Oct 9 07:04:29 2002 +0000

    Use Ant's Project.resolveFile() method to resolve scripts. This prevents "no
    protocol" errors when a jelly-using Ant script is invoked from a directory
    other than where the script lives.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135280 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 56b5cb8457af387ea48594c1ae9f18310dbdaf97
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Thu Oct 10 22:19:19 2002 +0000

    Added SOAP support via Apache Axis.
    
    This is based on a patch submitted by Jim Birchfield which allows SOAP services to be invoked using Apache Axis and the results output.
    
    Its early days and we'll improve this support considerably over time but at least the basics are working for now.
    
    There's a demo invokable via
    
      maven demo:soap
    
    which invokes a sample Axis echo service and an xmethods.net service.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135289 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 2631ab316aca445a3010c738d3fdff186d833e08
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Thu Oct 10 23:08:37 2002 +0000

    Minor patch so that the <soap:invoke> tag can take the parameters as an attribute...
    <soap:invoke params="${something}"../>
    
    Also added another example that converts MM to inches using a web service; using Floats.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135290 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit b11000f229bafc317506facc13d03e86809b7744
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>

commit b6602aaf4d7208bb6da73dca5bde745e332b0fa6
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Oct 16 12:45:53 2002 +0000

    Patch so that the internal TagFactory used by TagLibrary objects to create Tag instances now takes the name and XML attributes.
    This makes support for dynamically created tags, like with Ant, a little easier to support as now a TagLibrary can just directly register a TagFactory.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135301 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit d44ede9332ef9030e93717a574a26e017be1c7cf
Author: Morgan James Delagrange <morgand@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Oct 16 16:18:42 2002 +0000

    XMLParser.error(SAXParseException) and XMLParser.fatalError(SAXParseException)
    [but not XMLParser.warning(SAXParseException)] will now throw
    a SAXException by default when no error handler is supplied.  As a result,
    invalid Jelly scripts will now fail when validation is enabled by
    Jelly.setValidateXML(boolean).
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135302 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 2dd6cebfd3954741f960238359531c0dec6480ac
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Oct 16 18:17:58 2002 +0000

    Added a simple little Jelly library which binds beans to tags. It works similarly to Ant with nested properties so provides a simple way to turn XML into beans.
    While on the surface this may seem over the top when Digester and Betwixt (which is layered on top of Digester) do this perfectly well, using Jelly allows more complex directives like
    
    * including other files
    * using configurable properties or dynamic values in configuration files. So dynamic expressions can be used to hook-up objects or dynamically turn bits of the config on or off based on runtime properrties
    * the same mechanism can be used inside things like workflow, unit testing, JellySwing etc
    
    This library could be used to hack together an implementation of Ceki's Joran example for log4j
    
    http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=jakarta-commons-dev&m=103462608122650&w=2
    
    Though it'd need 1 or to extra little tags to implement the appender ref and to collect the appenders together into a Map etc.
    
    Hopefully some of the similar code in the define:bean and define:jellybean libraries could maybe be rationalised a little.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135303 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit d04c2293a9899d911f4d33f99cb844a57f45c7d0
Author: Morgan James Delagrange <morgand@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Oct 16 18:45:27 2002 +0000

    fixed naughty wildcard import for CLI
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135304 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 79d783d8876a3f160ca0a970b07d227f0efdc9ac
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Thu Oct 17 07:51:31 2002 +0000

    Added support for CollectionTag so that the bean tag library can be used to make collections of beans easily.
    
    Also refactored the bean tag library implementation a little so that both bean and property based tags work share the processing code (adding themselves to their parent via a setter, adder or a parent CollectionTag)
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135307 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 1ce8c2cc15c1e9642b1d948eac0105c49f8cc7f7
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Thu Oct 17 17:27:38 2002 +0000

    Patch for the <beanshell:script> support. There was a bug when using <beanshell:script> from inside Maven with variables containing dots.
    
    Now these have been removed; variables with dots are converted to "_".
    
    So if "foo.bar" is a variable in the context you can do this...
    
    <beanshell:script>
    System.out.println( foo_bar);
    
    System.out.println( context.getVariable("foo.bar") );
    
    // to set variables
    
    context.setVariable( "foo.bar", new Foo() );
    
    </beanshell:script>
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135308 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit b23fef891f24345665d54f0a35d8d4cd3ff2af9b
Author: Morgan James Delagrange <morgand@apache.org>
Date:   Thu Oct 17 18:23:48 2002 +0000

    Added XMLParser.parse(URL), changed XMLParser.parse(File) so that
    the XML parser will be able to resolve relative paths inside a DTD.
    
    Changed Jelly.compileScript() to pass a URL to the XMLParser
    instead of a stream, so that the XML parser will be able to resolve relative
    paths in a DTD.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135309 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 4eb4099e4b7800d3fb1fe7df5a79f017a6b53100
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Oct 23 15:39:40 2002 +0000

    Added a simple new tag to create a sorted Map of Maps of all the goals available in Maven indexed by plugin.
    
    So
    
    <useGoals var="goals"/>
    
    ${goals} is a map with key = plugin name and value = map, where its key = name of goal and value = Goal
    
    So can do
    
    ${goals.java} to get all the goals for the 'java' plugin
    
    or
    
    ${goals.java.compile} to find the java:compile goal
    
    This can be handy for things like the console or the new Swing Wizard that I'm half-way through writing with JellySwing...
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135329 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 7ce35ff296f646ee46b634a66fb877fdad62920b

commit 847610fb9c2c5293bdad8358bb56af5cf0d65b9c
Author: Dion Gillard <dion@apache.org>
Date:   Mon Oct 28 12:16:30 2002 +0000

    Fix bad javadoc comment

commit 5b0122c5b7c77f619a6eac30482de3823136d976

    parser was inappropriately trapping throwables, hiding classpath problems,

commit 2e193ec7037deda36c0848eb36ad129a72e12355
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Tue Oct 29 09:10:15 2002 +0000

    There is now an <x:doctype> tag which outputs the DOCTYPE event to the current (SAX) XML event stream. So you can use this inside a <j:file> tag. e.g.
    
    <j:file name="foo.xml">
      <x:doctype name="foo" publicId="whatever" systemId="foo.dtd"/>
      <foo>
      ...
      </foo>
    </j:file>
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135341 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 7f1cdf1e69ca3da7df9d1297d22fa617b432a2ef
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Oct 30 11:54:12 2002 +0000

    Committed patch supplied by Robert Leftwich which creates a Jetty tag library for creating HTTP servers for testing web requests using an embedded Jetty instance.
    
    It could be that there is some crossover with
    
    Latka
    http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/latka/index.html
    
    Anteater
    http://aft.sourceforge.net/
    
    or Cactus
    http://jakarta.apache.org/cactus/
    
    I'm not personally expert enough to know what should be done in this area. So I'm committing this and then the discussion between the various groups can start.
    It might be that one of the above projects could be a better home for the above code - lets see what the community at large thinks.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135342 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit dde4a6b3ce699ff58d615610fab6e4e724cceb31
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Fri Nov 8 18:27:52 2002 +0000

    Added support for NamespaceAwareTags. This allows Tag implementations to be given the namespace context in which they are used.
    This allows tags to, for example, map namespace qualified names to namespace URIs using namespace prefixes.
    
    For example in XSD or SOAP or BPEL styles of languages, qualified names like "x:foo" can be used. The 'x' is a prefix. The namespace context maps prefixes 'x' to the URI.
    
    This patch also means that all the XPath expressions in the XML library, JSL and JellyUnit can also make use of the XPath prefixes that are available.
    This allows full namespace-based XPath to be used.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135357 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit ebe89ee9a30f7612375561d27782fd9e4abfc27d
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Fri Nov 8 18:35:06 2002 +0000

    enhanced test case to demonstrate that XPath should not find elements in a document with a namespace URI but no prefix - unless the XPath expression has a prefix.
    This is a very common XPath gotcha.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135358 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 59a659013313e6d21fcd4795f379578fb62e6264

commit e1d7b688c434a1c9b05157a77e08907e7e29a243
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Tue Nov 12 10:50:36 2002 +0000

    minor patch to work around an XPath ordering bug in Jaxen
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135369 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 6fe6b6849f23fbc68eac44789ed3c4f2c5ac98b3
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Nov 13 09:03:31 2002 +0000

    Added a JellyUnit test case to demonstrate the bug that J. Matthew Pryor recently found in the XPath feature in Jelly.
    
    Plus I've now fixed the bug. When using the namespace context for the XPath expression, the default no-prefix namespace should not be used, as this breaks XPath and hides the default XPath function libraries.
    Inside XPath, the default namespace (i.e. when no prefix is used) should always be "".
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135370 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 3bd494812543c3085e653c70343510e9463364c3
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Nov 13 12:59:35 2002 +0000

    Added a new helper tag, <util:available> which can be used to test for files or URIs being available and conditionally executing its body.
    
    so its like a simplified version of the <available> Ant task without requiring the use of a seperate property to define whether the file is available or not.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135371 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit e284d995b0a84e37099d705a43f692eba0d94732
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Tue Nov 19 13:14:00 2002 +0000

    Added an example of working JSL stylesheets. In particular the reuse of a single JSL stylesheet within a loop works fine.
    
    Still haven't fixed dIon's bug yet but it appears to be an issue caused by the tag hierarchy being stale when a stylesheet is defined within a loop (the ExprTag thinks it has the 1st parent tag when it is invoked for the 2nd time). I should have a fix for this very soon....
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135383 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit f4cc1b3d97e7734215fc2edc78408f3dd94b1e7c
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Tue Nov 19 13:28:43 2002 +0000

    Patch to fix dIon's bug with JSL. The fix was for TagScript to properly set the parent tag each time its used; there was a danger of the Tag being cached and its old parent being used when inside loops. This should now fix any similar related bugs.
    
    Moving forward, it might be worth optimizing the TagScript code so that the Script.run() method takes the parent Tag to use. Then the thread local tag hierarchy can be maintained on the stack, rather than using ThreadLocal variables that we currently use. This would be faster and simpler I suspect.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135384 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit f2a77f136c4aea68c305e084e41a68fba8534d1f
Author: Dion Gillard <dion@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Nov 20 05:54:11 2002 +0000

    Added test case to show xmloutput context being lost using apply templates
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135385 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 279784a42dbc0442de9e7ddb5c663aefeb2b92ec
Author: Dion Gillard <dion@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Nov 20 06:05:19 2002 +0000

    Added inline version of test case
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135386 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 0dc7bc828e3c27a7ea9a3d4b2131f9a322f45080
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Nov 20 22:20:21 2002 +0000

    Patch applied for the bug found by dIon. Also added a few more test cases to fully test this feature to ensure it doesn't break again.
    
    The bug essentially was that the <applyTemplates> is often invoked from a different XMLOutput, which needs to be associated with the Stylesheet so that as new <template>s fire they use the correct XMLOutput.
    This is required as things like <j:set> use a different XMLOutput to buffer up its body.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135387 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 14f507700a20dfe52c34336bf6ac9acf32f1f53e
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Nov 20 22:43:42 2002 +0000

    added back the xmlns="dummy" that was originally added in dIons original test. I'd forgotten I'd disabled it when trying to figure out the reason for the bug.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135388 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 8e0f7321c5231fe0f4543308ba57aa580a00862a
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Thu Nov 21 12:41:23 2002 +0000

    I've enabled the JellyUnit test case that Peter wrote and added another to both test for a regular nested <filterset> and one using a refid.
    
    Also added a fix for it too! The short answer is the problem was due to treating <filter> as a new task rather than a nested property of <filterset>
    
    Again this is due to the complexity of the Ant behaviour. Sometimes Ant tags are meant to be Tasks, sometimes they are meant to be nested properties, and this can get confusing. I think the correct logic right now is that...
    
      a tag should be considered task if it is the root node in the tree of Ant tags and the name of the tag is a valid Ant task name, otherwise treat it as a nested property or datatype.
    
    So the root tag can be a <filterset id="...">. Also there are times when a task shouldn't be treated as a task but instead as a nested property. e.g. <filter> and <manifest> are tasks but should be treated as nested properties.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135389 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit c9250459ddaa1181f7ab9c12e07aba66987720e6

commit eb6905c8dd468baffb94c79f8e776009d315176d
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Nov 27 16:46:10 2002 +0000

    Applied Knut Wannheden's patch that allows XML documents to be compared for equality within a JellyUnit test case.
    
    Now JellyUnit has most bases covered for XML testing
    
    * XPath based assertions via <test:assert xpath="..."/>
    * schema validation via the jelly:validate library, testing XML against DTDs, XML Schema, RelaxNG etc
    * comparing 2 documents for equality
    * performing XSLT on some XML and then then performing any of the above
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135406 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit d71e0d02b968dca765170b145a058802275b573d
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Nov 27 19:22:42 2002 +0000

    Patch to Jason's XPath sorting implementation that uses XPaths numerical functions instead of taking a Java Class to perform conversions.
    
    So to sort by the foo attribute you could use
    
    @foo
    
    for textual sorting or for numeric sorting...
    
    number(@foo)
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135410 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 3e75855c050ce2a3fd3b3ba901b5d53db6269ac4
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Thu Nov 28 08:35:48 2002 +0000

    Added support for LocationAware tags and exceptions. This allows tags or exceptions to be aware of where in a Jelly script they are invoked or thrown.
    
    This is particularly useful in JellyUnit. Now all the JellyUnit assertion failures throw JellyAssertionFailedErrrors which include details of where in the Jelly script the failure occurred.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135412 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

    Applied a slight modificaiton of Knut Wannheden's patch that adds a <test:assertThrown> tag that expects the body to throw an exception.
    
    This makes JellyUnit testing of things which are expected to throw an exception much easier.

commit d18ef686392b36633c6b25c6724dced2d058c36f
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Fri Dec 13 18:08:31 2002 +0000

    I've added a new <x:comment> tag to output a comment to the underlying XML event stream.
    
    So it can be used inside any Jelly script via either
    
        <x:comment>this is a comment</x:comment>
    
    or
    
        <x:comment text="this is a comment"/>
    
    
    I've added JellyUnit test cases to ensure this works (see the end of the file)
    
    http://cvs.apache.org/viewcvs/jakarta-commons-sandbox/jelly/src/test/org/apache/commons/jelly/xml/suite.jelly?rev=HEAD
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135437 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit ed20c1b2d1bd27325f3ee9599fe80b5f451cad5a
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Thu Dec 19 15:03:51 2002 +0000

    Patch to allow the HTML tag library full control over NeckoHTML's ability to convert elements or attributes to upper or lowercase.
    
    You can now specify if you wish case conversion to be applied when parsing HTML.
    
    e.g. to upper case the elements but lowercase the attributes you can do...
    
        <html:parse var="doc" html="index.html" element="upper" attribute="lower"/>
    
    or to make everything lower case
    
        <html:parse var="doc" html="index.html" element="lower" attribute="lower"/>
    
    
    The default is to leave case as it was but to match element case (so that open and close elements have the same case).
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135450 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit e405ec1759c83043746af9f90006ac6e66072b7f
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Thu Dec 19 17:22:36 2002 +0000

    Patch to add better error reporting if wrong SWT style codes are used and handle constructors of widgets better.
    
    Also added an example of using trees. Have added a TableTree example but can't seem to get the text values to dislpay :-(
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135451 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit afd2936f6f63f8c0660aba4f0b9b83f224f973ab
Author: Bob McWhirter <werken@apache.org>
Date:   Tue Dec 24 04:50:19 2002 +0000

    Experimental support in XPathExpression to allow actual xpath expression
    text to be resolved from a jexl expression.
    
    ie:
    
      <j:set var="foo" value="/foo/bar/baz"/>
      <x:expr select="${foo}"/>
    
    should work.
    
    Previously, the contents of the @select had to be static text, without
    any ${jexl}-style textual evaluation.  The text itself is now a CompositeExpression.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135454 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135666 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 58d431cc42ee6a5281ee1f4cb21f0ff9c7ff4751
Author: Bob McWhirter <werken@apache.org>
Date:   Sat Mar 1 21:01:05 2003 +0000

    Small fix to allow a DynaTag, which masked as a StaticTag, to
    actually have an Expression received for setAttribute().
    
    Previously, when hidden by the StaticTag, the getAttributeType()
    method was ignored and all expressions were evaluate()'d prior
    to the call to setAttribute().  Simply added a check for
    getAttributeType().
    
    
    PR:
    Obtained from:
    Submitted by:
    Reviewed by:
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135819 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 2c8d60bad0aab028b8efe356019fd58e4548bbd7
Author: Bob McWhirter <werken@apache.org>
Date:   Mon Mar 3 05:37:37 2003 +0000

    Adding the throws JellyTagException to the setAttribute(...) so that
    sub-classes can throw it, even though StaticTag itself does not.
    
    Is there a mode for checkstyle to ensure that subclasses throw
    the same exceptions as their super-classes/super-interfaces so
    that unwritten-yet subclasses can still throw them as an option?
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135820 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Tue Mar 4 08:25:29 2003 +0000

    Applied patch supplied by Robert McIntosh

commit 65b964cf6400823b934ed3c29c6758593f08793d
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Mar 5 08:11:56 2003 +0000

    Applied patches kindly supplied by Pete Kazmier to to fix a number of things in the BSF support including...
    
     -  The existing ScriptTag calls the BSF eval() method, which can
         only be used to evaluate single expressions. To evaluate a
         script, the exec() method must be used.  This patch fixes that
         issue.
    
      -  Updated the BSF Taglib to use the latest and greatest BSF thats
         been moved into the jakarta namespace.  Also provides more
         support for addtional languages.
    
      -  The ScriptTag was not populating the BSF object registry so the
         jelly context was not available to scripts.  I used the same hack
         that was used for the expressions, could be cleaned up, just
         wanted to get this in so we had something working.
    
      -  Added a JythonTagLibrary in addition to the JPythonTagLibrary.
         Also updated jelly.properties to register this tag library under
         "jython".
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135827 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit e2efeda53ca1d07bbbc593223af21676a4b18b16
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Mar 5 08:13:19 2003 +0000

    added Pete to contributor list (though hey, Pete should probably be a committer by now :)
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135828 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 66c9afc298b06349f21e18ee3707bb035773f6f0
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Thu Mar 6 11:50:41 2003 +0000

    added a first cut of a parse tag that can be used to parse a Jelly script from a string or from the output of its body
    
    <j:parse text="${foo}"/>
    
    or
    
    <j:parse>
            <!-- something that generates XML -->
    </j:parse>
    
    if a var attribute is speciried then the scirpt is defined; otherwise its executed
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135831 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 343459ce8877418d4fc1f47100222d5942967eb6
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Fri Mar 7 12:21:28 2003 +0000

    added support for a defaultValue attribute which allows a default value to be specified in cases where the value expression is null or a blank string.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135832 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 325cfeadc56d1383f3fdd2a4a80d485d936a649c
Author: James Strachan <jstrachan@apache.org>
Date:   Fri Mar 7 13:17:54 2003 +0000

    Allow derived JellyContext implementations to customize the XMLParser implementation used when including Jelly scripts.
    
    This allows custom contexts to configure the parsing, such as to register certain namespaces, to enable validation or to register alternative ExpresionFactory instances
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135833 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 0581182aa7421c42b20432a608e191f8c683692e
Author: Tim O'Brien <tobrien@apache.org>
Date:   Thu Sep 4 02:37:59 2003 +0000

    Fixed a rendering problem with the example code in the tutorial page.  In the example of embedding Jelly, there were bold tags within the preformatted Java code - Maven's site generation was adding newlines around these bolded variable names.  These bold tags were removed, and all code examples now have indentation.

commit 5a73ffd00f3c24dc75d1412b491931e1cce72381
Author: Paul Libbrecht <polx@apache.org>
Date:   Tue Feb 3 22:44:17 2004 +0000

    Adding a goal named pack-fat-jar so that one can pack a binary of jelly and
    all its dependent in one double-clickable jar.
    Use as follows:
     maven pack-fat-jar -DtagLibs=xml,util
    java -jar target/jellypack.jar myFile.jelly
    
    Not much tested, thanks to comment!
    paul
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135921 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit dc3e0e891d6fab6eee50c34b614e96fac8d22972
Author: Dion Gillard <dion@apache.org>
Date:   Thu Apr 15 04:51:24 2004 +0000

    One of the things that have changed between Ant 1.5.x and 1.6.0 is
    that <ant> and friends now check whether they are part of a circular
    invocation by comparing the current build file location with the one
    of the file they are supposed to call.  This new code assumed that
    ant.file has been set.
    
    Actually, in the context of Jelly the value doesn't matter at all, so
    you could set it to something arbitrary.  I've chosen to use the
    String form of JellyContext#getCurrentURL in my patch, but you may
    want to use something different.
    
    Stefan
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135974 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 3e25fbb5601b0bca6d9d9d59d3b8548613142e44
Author: Robert Burrell Donkin <rdonkin@apache.org>
Date:   Sat May 1 11:05:11 2004 +0000

    Changed a broken url and changed the link from apache to jakarta (to bring jelly in line with most other commons sites).
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135975 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 92400ff387a181de2ef0d42dead04db39d9fb1ee
Author: Daniel Savarese <dfs@apache.org>
Date:   Sat Jun 5 01:29:16 2004 +0000

    The <component/> tag was not registered in SwingTagLibrary but was listed
    in the documentation as being a JellySwing tag.  I had a need to use
    the tag and took the liberty of adding the registration of the tag in
    the SwingTagLibrary constructor.  After verifying it worked properly,
    I'm committing the change and adding myself to the project developers
    list in project.xml.  The convention for unit testing JellySwing tags
    was non-obvious to me, so I did not add a test at this time.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135979 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 1ea1273c61ac9f406df43e944f11d783d3df901b
Author: Daniel Savarese <dfs@apache.org>
Date:   Sat Jun 5 02:23:41 2004 +0000

    In the thread on commons-dev starting at:
      http://www.mail-archive.com/commons-dev@jakarta.apache.org/msg41386.html
    we discussed the addition to Jelly of the ability to retrieve the
    values of static fields.  The participants of the discussion agreed
    that the functionality was desirable as a core feature.  However, it
    was also pointed out that perhaps Jexl is the right place for this
    functionality to exist.  Given the immediate utility of the
    functionality and the general agreement that it would be okay to
    add a new core tag to fulfill the need, I have added a GetStaticTag
    class that implements a <getStatic/> tag to retrieve static fields
    in classes, modeled along the ines of <invokeStatic/>.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135980 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 0511b07a5d801eed0c54930da1d20abaad8c75ea
Author: Daniel Savarese <dfs@apache.org>
Date:   Sat Jun 5 03:23:37 2004 +0000

    Added a simple test for GetStaticTag, modeled after the tests for
    InvokeStaticTag.
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@135981 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 551139d2abd59b5925c710048649ae4c252b8f86
Author: Paul Libbrecht <polx@apache.org>
Date:   Tue Dec 28 01:39:23 2004 +0000

    Tag caching is now done in the JellyContext.
    The TestCoreMemoryLeak shows that, at least with some usage of JellyContext.clear(), one avoids leaks.
    Removing Tag-caching flag. Also, removing the WeakReferenceWrapperScript, both were in the era of ThreadLocal which is to be finished.
    
    Have tested these with an amount of the tag-libs... had to change the XML one but otherwise apparently none.
    
    Feedback and testing eagerly welcome!
    paul
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@136390 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit c3a4d8264bf6f4b2200686101ebcce6267797e34
Author: Paul Libbrecht <polx@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Jan 26 22:46:28 2005 +0000

    First stab at rerunnable tags.
    Using <panel tagName="myTag">DO SOMETHING${x}</panel>
    One can invoke, later, e.g. in an action-tag, ${myTag.rerun()} which should
    repopulate the panel by removing first then re-running the body
    ot this tag.
    paul
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@136446 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit dfcf0e8cf601b6c8fe7bf4babd6ac8e0fc57e085
Author: Paul Libbrecht <polx@apache.org>
Date:   Sun Jan 30 07:47:05 2005 +0000

    x:set was returning empty-list in case of empty results whereas it used
    to return a null (which becomes an empty string often in jexl or jelly).
    Fixed so that when asString, single, and delim attributes are not set,
    it is backwards compatible.
    Reverted to the multi-slot evaluation-style as opposed to the single
    policy introduced by Michael Schuerig.
    paul
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@149113 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 798a0ac305b3375be3a52351603feaec12cb52ed

Date:   Sun Jan 30 23:02:28 2005 +0000

    Use SVN changelog
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@149180 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit 01b3bd9fddc832ddb1b6875689df3f2af79ed735
Author: Niall Pemberton <niallp@apache.org>
Date:   Tue Feb 14 01:15:14 2006 +0000

    Modify maven build to add two non-standard attributes to the jar's manifest file to indicate the values of "maven.compile.source" and "maven.compile.target". Also modify the build to include an "Implementation-Vendor-Id" of "org.apache" in the jar's manifest.
    
    The two non-standard entires created in the manifest file will look something like the following:
    
    X-Compile-Source-JDK: 1.3
    X-Compile-Target-JDK: 1.3
    
    This change serves two purposes:
    
      1) To provide comfort to users regarding JVM compatibility.
      2) Enable releases to be checked more easily for JVM compatibility.
    
    The manifest specification indicates that "unknown" entries in the manifest file are ignored. These entries have been prefixed with "X-" which is a sometimes used "convention" for indicating non-standard entries.
    
    See thread: http://tinyurl.com/839zh
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@377558 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit f9a9e5c1cb61af5a4e82ad4c6c533652bbbff7f8
Author: Brett Porter <brett@apache.org>
Date:   Wed Feb 15 08:23:50 2006 +0000

    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@377962 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

commit af9f8b84cb71faf13f49a8ab76cb4a29282c47d4
Author: Rahul Akolkar <rahul@apache.org>
Date:   Tue Jul 31 04:17:09 2007 +0000

    TLP related blanket changes:
    
    s:jakarta.apache.org/commons:commons.apache.org:
    s/commons-user@jakarta.apache.org/user@commons.apache.org/
    s/commons-dev@jakarta.apache.org/dev@commons.apache.org/
    s/Jakarta Commons/Apache Commons/
    s:svn.apache.org/viewcvs/jakarta/commons:svn.apache.org/viewvc/commons:
    s:svn.apache.org/viewcvs.cgi/jakarta/commons:svn.apache.org/viewvc/commons:
    s:svn.apache.org/viewvc/jakarta/commons:svn.apache.org/viewvc/commons:
    s:svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons:svn.apache.org/repos/asf/commons:
    
    I'd appreciate another pair of eyes on this. There are some categories we probably don't want to change ATM (hopefully, none of these snuck in):
     * Historicals (proposals etc.)
     * URLs that shouldn't change (DOCTYPE fragments etc.)
     * Test cases where namespace URLs matter etc. (I'll track any related nightly failures)
    
    
    git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/commons/proper/jelly/trunk@561230 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68

    paul
